1.title: The Sentencing Project
1.subtitle: The Sentencing Project promotes effective and humane responses to crime that minimize imprisonment and criminalization of youth and adults by promoting racial, ethnic, economic, and gender justice.

Starting with an inventory of 10 products and packing packages on the floor of our apartment, we never imagined how far we would get!

3.title: Brimz Official

Wherever artistic expression exists, culture and progress are always by its side.

products.name: AJ1 Sneaker Hoodie

It's alot of love when you're wearing this dad hat, full of the gritty city pride we've grown to love and embrace.

products.name: Blessed Beanie
products.description: Stay blessed all winter long! If winter is your thing then you're truly blessed to not be bothered by the cold, but if that day does come and you need protection the blessed beanie will hold you down.

3.title: Open Yale Courses: African American History: From Emancipation to the Present
3.subtitle: The purpose of this course is to examine the African American experience in the United States from 1863 to the present. Prominent themes include the end of the Civil War and the beginning of Reconstruction; African Americans’ urbanization experiences; the development of the modern civil rights movement and its aftermath; and the thought and leadership of Booker T. Washington, Ida B. Wells-Barnett, W.E.B. Du Bois, Marcus Garvey, Martin Luther King Jr., and Malcolm X.

4.title: NSPRE Electronics
4.subtitle: The NSPRE™ brand is built on and strives for creativity and culture. We create exciting, lifestyle, and innovative products that inspire everyday use. Our vision is to "Inspire the culture through social technology" to improve others' lifestyles and the way we access the world around us.

products.name: Lynx Bluetooth® Sunglasses
products.description: No earplugs or ear coverings. Open concept sound with privacy. Designed with Ultra Modern materials and a lightweight frame design. Connects to any mobile device with Bluetooth® ability.

products.name: NX Pro Plus LE (128G)

4.title: Whistling Vivaldi
4.subtitle: Claude M. Steele, who has been called "one of the few great social psychologists," offers a vivid first-person account of the research that supports his groundbreaking conclusions on stereotypes and identity.

5.title: Kids Swag
5.subtitle: Great action is taking place to improve diversity in books and dolls and there are a number of different vendors making it easier to find these great items. But what about everything else in your child's world? You go grocery shopping, what image is on the cute plate and cup set your child wants? You're want to encourage their creativity, what images are in their colouring books? You're throwing a birthday party, what are your options?
5.moreInfo: The list can go on and on. It is an unnecessarily complicated task to source and purchase everyday lifestyle products for children that have black images. These companies exist but one must be internet savvy and social media literate to find them. KIDS SWAG was launched in December 2016 to make it easy for parents to build environments that are reflective of their child's beauty.

products.name: Nia Ballerina Backpack
products.description: This beautifully illustrated pink rucksack is the perfect accessory for your little ballerina, which is both lightweight and practical with plenty of storage. Made from durable and water-resistant material this rucksack features a colourful design with two images of Nia Ballerina on the front.

products.name: Nana Yaa
products.description: Nana means Queen or King in West Africa , Ghana. The founders of Nana Dolls wanted to teach the younger generation of their history whilst also having fun. There were many strong courageous women from all over Africa who helped to fight for freedom.

products.name: Super Friends Onesie
products.description: Your little Superhero featured as your favourite Superhero.

5.title: The Case for Reparations
5.subtitle: Two hundred fifty years of slavery. Ninety years of Jim Crow. Sixty years of separate but equal. Thirty-five years of racist housing policy. Until we reckon with our compounding moral debts, America will never be whole.

6.title: Namascents Candle Co
6.subtitle: Namascents Candle Co crafts candles and home fragrance products for any space; welcoming peace, stillness and good thoughts. Our inspiration is nature, love + memories. We keep it clean + simple with a scentful twist.

7.title: Gentleman AF

products.name: Beard Balms
products.description: Scoop a dime sized amount of beard balm with your finger and place it in the palm of your hands. Rub it between both palms until it melts. Apply it to your beard, comb it down and style as desired.

products.name: Beard Wash
products.description: Wet your face and neck, place a small amount of beard wash in the palm of your hands and massage it into your beard and face, including your neck. Rinse your beard thoroughly.

products.name: Beard Oils
products.description: Shake well before use. Drop a dime sized amount of beard oil in the palm of your hands. Rub your hands and apply the oil from your skin to the tip of your beard.

7.title: Ava DuVernay's "13th"
7.subtitle: In this thought-provoking documentary, scholars, activists and politicians analyze the criminalization of African Americans and the U.S. prison boom.

8.title: Plum Good
8.subtitle: Plum Good locally produces, discriminately sources and proudly brings to market the highest quality culinary and restorative spices, herbs and tea blends available. Our mission is to help bring flavorful nutrition available to our customers.  We make All Natural rubs and blends, teas, jams and sauces.

products.name: Paprika Lime Blend
products.description: This SALT FREE blend of citrus, paprika, garlic, and lime gives color, zest, and mouth watering flavor to fish, chicken, and poultry.

products.name: Organic Chai Tea

products.name: Sweet & Hot Chocolate Sauce
products.description: A culinary gourmet delight for cooks and foodies alike! Choice serrano and chocolate peppers, dark chocolate, balsamic vinegar, raw sugar, cardamom and water make a mouthwatering marinade, topping or accompaniment and make everything it comes into contact with delicious.

8.title: The Hate U Give
8.subtitle: Based on the best-selling novel, The Hate U Give tells the story of Starr Carter, who lives in two worlds: the poor, black neighborhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. This uneasy balance is shattered when she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman. Facing pressures from all sides, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what’s right.

9.title: Afro Flow Yoga
9.subtitle:
With over 14 years of experience, Leslie Salmon Jones continues to pursue an active interdisciplinary career in health and dance in Boston and New York City. A Toronto native, Leslie received her B.A. in Dance and Health Studies at the State University of New York, and her Fitness Instructors Certification at New York University. She was a scholarship recipient at the esteemed Alvin Ailey Dance Theatre in New York City as well as the London Contemporary Dance School.

As a professional dancer, Leslie worked with known greats such as Judith Jameson, Bill T. Jones and Wynton Marsalis. At her studio in New York, she developed her own exercise program based on various techniques honed through working with her personal training clientele on a daily basis. Today she continues to divide her time between New York City and Boston.

Leslie has extensive experience in the fitness industry, including being a consultant for the New York Knicks healthy lifestyle clinic that teaches self-esteem to youth. She also served as a board member for the organization, Free Arts for Abused Kids, NYC. Today, she serves as a board member of the United Nations Association of New York

9.title: Center for Policing Equity
9.subtitle: Your donation fuels our ability to lead on the police reform that's necessary. Together we will create a public safety system that protects and preserves justice for all.

10.title: Figgers Communication Inc.
10.subtitle: Figgers Communication is where the entire buzz on the internet and social media comes to rest in your pocket! We are a telecommunications company that provides Cellular, Mobile Broadband, Home phone and international calling services.

10.title: How we're honoring people overlooked by history
10.subtitle: Since its founding in 1851, the "New York Times" has published thousands of obituaries — for heads of state, famous celebrities, even the inventor of the sock puppet. But only a small percentage of them chronicle the lives of women and people of color. In this insightful talk, "Times" editor Amy Padnani shares the story behind "Overlooked," the project she's leading to recognize people from history whose deaths were ignored — and refocus society's lens on who is considered important.

11.title: Soul Cap
11.subtitle: Haircare for the volume-blessed. Being blessed with voluminous hair shouldn’t come with the curse of harsh chemicals or mediocre products.

11.title: The Costs of Racism to White People
11.subtitle: We tend to think of racism as a problem for people of color and something we should be concerned about for their sake. However, the costs of racism to white people are devastating, especially to those of us without the money and power to buffer their effects.

12.title: Pod Save the People Podcast
12.subtitle: On Pod Save the People, DeRay Mckesson explores news, culture, social justice, and politics with Sam Sinyangwe, Kaya Henderson and De’Ara Balenger. They offer a unique take on the news, with a special focus on overlooked stories and topics that often impact people of color.

12.title: 15th Amendment
12.subtitle: The 15th Amendment granting African-American men the right to vote was adopted into the U.S. Constitution in 1870.

13.title: Bedroom Kandi

products.description: Homemade whipped body butter with all-natural ingredients designed to keep your skin hydrated, youthful, and healthy. products.name: Lip Balm
products.description: Organic Natural Lip Balm that is homemade and great for dry lips or any lips. The ingredients listed below were all included to keep your lips smooth, full, and healthy even after application!

14.title: Timeline of investigation into Tyre Nichols' death should be the "blueprint"

15.subtitle: Civil Rights Act, (1964), comprehensive U.S. legislation intended to end discrimination based on race, colour, religion, or national origin.

16.title: Dawoud Bey: The Birmingham Project
16.subtitle: In 2005 American photographer Dawoud Bey visited Birmingham, Alabama, to explore the possibility of making work that would commemorate the September 15, 1963, bombing of the 16th Street Baptist Church. The Birmingham Project, a series that includes photographic diptychs and a split-screen video, is Bey’s powerful response.

22.title: What Happened in Kenosha, WI?
22.subtitle: Cellphone video of the incident shows police officers in Kenosha, Wisconsin shooting a Black man multiple times on August 23 as he tried to get into a vehicle. Read more about the incident and the protests that followed here.

22.title: 210 Teas
22.subtitle:
Inspired by the 5 bags of black tea brewed  on my late grandmother’s stove, that were to later be stirred with sugar and offered to anyone that entered her kitchen, 210 Teas honors the subtle yet strong essence of my grandmother. For me, tea is a reminder of my family – a reminder of generational love. Tea provides a soothing sense of comfort that speaks without words, like the omnipresent protection of your ancestors.

The mission of 210 Teas is to share that comfort with everyone I can reach. From my cup … to yours, with love.

23.title: AcARRE

products.description: BEST VALUE! Try all three: Original, Sweet N Spicy, Ghost Pepper

25.title: Justice for Jacob Blake
25.subtitle: Jacob Blake is a loving father of 6 that deserves proper medical attention and legal representation. The funds raised through this Gofundme will go toward Jacob’s medical bills, family expenses, legal representation, support for his children and therapy costs.

25.title: Text a bot for book suggestions
25.subtitle: Twitter user @ecmoy created a bot that you can text for recommendations of books written by Black authors based on genre. It will also link you to a Black-owned bookstore that is selling the title. Text (409) 404-0403 to try it!

26.title: Omalicha Naturals
26.subtitle: Omalicha translates to beautiful in our native language of Igbo. We handcraft all natural, clean beauty products for the hair and skin designed to bring ones natural beauty to the forefront.

products.name: Sweet Marula Replenishing Facial Serum
products.description: Our Sweet Marula Replenishing Facial serum is a blend of light oils and botanical extracts. This meticulous blend soothes and moisturizes the skin after cleansing, easily penetrating the skin revealing an instant glow.

products.name: Lavender Cucumber Bliss facial toner
products.description: Our Lavender Cucumber Bliss facial toner soothes and restores balance to the skin. Its non-alcoholic astringent fights breakouts without drying the skin.

products.name: Avocado Mango Deep Treatment Mask
products.description: Our Avocado Mango Deep Treatment Mask is a thick, creamy deep conditioner fortified with luscious oils, botanical extracts and soft butters. It is used after cleansing the hair to impart moisture and elasticity back into your strands.

26.title: Justice For Tony McDade
26.subtitle: Tony McDade was a transgender black man who got killed by police in Tallahassee. Sign this petition and encourage others to do so as well to get his name out there.

27.title: The Black Family in the Age of Mass Incarceration
27.subtitle: By author Ta-Nehisi Coates: Fifty years after Daniel Patrick Moynihan’s report “The Negro Family” tragically helped create this system, it's time to reclaim his original intent.

27.title: NAACP Legal Defense and Education Fund
27.subtitle: Through litigation, advocacy, and public education, LDF seeks structural changes to expand democracy, eliminate disparities, and achieve racial justice in a society that fulfills the promise of equality for all Americans. LDF also defends the gains and protections won over the past 75 years of civil rights struggle and works to improve the quality and diversity of judicial and executive appointments.

28.title: Sugarfoots
28.subtitle: Sugarfoots anchor product is a renowned child-safe, hand-crafted multi-ethnic rag doll, complemented by a children’s book series based on folktales from cultures around the world. Our mission is sustained by a performing arts summer camp for youth that sets the pace among competitors, inspiriting the imagination through creative storytelling, song and dance.

products.name: Cinnamon

products.name: Boy Dolls

products.name: Black Lives Matter Sugarfoots Bistro 16oz Mugs
products.description: What better way to show solidarity with Cocoa, Ginger and Cinnamon Black Lives Matter Sugarfoots Bistro Mugs!

28.title: Swimming caps designed for natural hair banned from Tokyo Olympic Games
28.subtitle: Swimming caps designed for natural Black hair — and created by a Black-owned company — will not be allowed at the upcoming Olympic Games in Tokyo. The International Swimming Federation said the caps do not follow "the natural form of the head," British brand Soul Cap told BBC News.

29.title: Build for Black Lives
29.subtitle: Are you an anti-racist designer, developer, data scientist, or marketing specialist interested in committing to pro bono projects to work towards reparations and racial justice? Work on one of our available projects.

29.title: Amanda Gorman Inauguration Poem
29.subtitle: Watch and read the youngest poet laureate, Amanda Gorman, recite her poem "The Hill We Climb"

30.title: Negro League Baseball
30.subtitle: Negro League Baseball got its start thanks to the increasing popularity of two things after the Civil War: baseball and segregation.

30.title: National Bail Out
30.subtitle: National Bail Out is a Black-led and Black-centered collective of abolitionist organizers, lawyers and activists building a community-based movement to support our folks and end systems of pretrial detention and ultimately mass incarceration. We are people who have been impacted by cages — either by being in them ourselves or witnessing our families and loved ones be encaged. We are queer, trans, young, elder, and immigrant.

31.title: A.O. Hamer
31.subtitle:
Hey, I'm Aramis and I love color!

My acrylic paintings are inspired by divine femininity, music, higher consciousness, and the cosmos. Liberation is my life's work- to free myself from the chains that could hold me back mentally, physically, and spiritually. My paintbrush reminds me of the creative power I have within the canvas - and life. As I take this journey to freedom, I hope to inspire others along the way.

31.title: Amazing Essence
31.subtitle: Amazing Essence is a Philadelphia based, one-woman small business built on a dream of entrepreneurship. Our handcrafted products are created using 100% soy wax without additives, natural (lead-free) cotton wick and high quality fragrance oils without phthalates or additives.

products.name: 25 oz. Triple Wick Candle Bowl
products.description: The Amazing Essence 25 oz. candle bowls are handcrafted using natural soy wax, high quality fragrance oils without phthalates and a natural cotton wick to ensure a clean, toxic-free burn in your home or office.

products.name: 4oz. Linen Spray
products.description: Mist our handcrafted linen sprays into the air liberally to Relax, Balance or Uplift your senses. When misting Linen, Spray 7 inches away and only on washable fabric. Contains essential oils/highly quality fragrance oils.

products.name: 8oz. Herbal Candles
products.description: The Amazing Essence 8 oz. herbal candles are handcrafted using natural soy wax, and fused with dried herbs, high quality fragrance oils without phthalates and a natural cotton wick to ensure a clean, toxic-free burn in your home or office. Approx 40hr of burn time.
